messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Just to clarify—would you like to see  

1. Reminders that were scheduled to go off yesterday,  
2. Reminders that you created (added) yesterday, or  
3. Both?
Sure—could you tell me today’s date (and, if relevant, your time-zone)? That way I can calculate exactly which 24-hour period counts as “yesterday” for you and pull the right reminders.
Sorry, I don't know today's date.

No problem! To figure out exactly which 24-hour stretch counts as “yesterday” for you, I still need to know your time-zone (or at least roughly where you are). Could you let me know—e.g. “UTC-5”, “America/Los_Angeles”, “Sydney”, etc.?
I'm not sure about that either.

No worries—time-zones can be tricky!

To make sure I grab exactly the right reminders, I still need some frame of reference for what “yesterday” means for you. Could you give me one of these?

• The city or region you’re in (e.g., “Paris”, “Tokyo”, “California”),  
• An approximate UTC offset (e.g., “around UTC-5”), or  
• Simply tell me to use the time-zone your device is set to (if that works for you).

Any one of those will let me pin down the correct 24-hour window.
